intro: Dentaria corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered toothplant, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant produces small, white or pale purple flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and have a slightly toothed margin. Dentaria corymbosa typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands.
